key.name: mouse-button-modifier
key.summary: Modifier to use for modified window click actions
key.description: Clicking a window while holding down this modifier key will move the window (left click), resize the window (middle click), or show the window menu (right click). The middle and right click operations may be swapped using the "resize_with_right_button" key. Modifier is expressed as "<Alt>" or "<Super>" for example.

key.name: resize-with-right-button
key.summary: Whether to resize with the right button
key.description: Set this to true to resize with the right button and show a menu with the middle button while holding down the key given in "mouse_button_modifier"; set it to false to make it work the opposite way around.

key.name: show-tab-border
key.summary: Whether to display preselected tab window border
key.description: Set this to false to disable border of preselected window while performing tab switching.

key.name: button-layout
key.summary: Arrangement of buttons on the titlebar
key.description: Arrangement of buttons on the titlebar. The value should be a string, such as "menu:minimize,maximize,spacer,close"; the colon separates the left corner of the window from the right corner, and the button names are comma-separated. Duplicate buttons are not allowed. Unknown button names are silently ignored so that buttons can be added in future marco versions without breaking older versions. A special spacer tag can be used to insert some space between two adjacent buttons.

key.name: focus-mode
key.description: The window focus mode indicates how windows are activated. It has three possible values; "click" means windows must be clicked in order to focus them, "sloppy" means windows are focused when the mouse enters the window, and "mouse" means windows are focused when the mouse enters the window and unfocused when the mouse leaves the window.

key.name: focus-new-windows
key.summary: Control how new windows get focus
key.description: This option provides additional control over how newly created windows get focus. It has two possible values; "smart" applies the user's normal focus mode, and "strict" results in windows started from a terminal not being given focus.

key.name: raise-on-click
key.summary: Whether raising should be a side-effect of other user interactions
key.description: Setting this option to false can lead to buggy behavior, so users are strongly discouraged from changing it from the default of true. Many actions (e.g. clicking in the client area, moving or resizing the window) normally raise the window as a side-effect. Setting this option to false, which is strongly discouraged, will decouple raising from other user actions, and ignore raise requests generated by applications. See http://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=445447#c6. Even when this option is false, windows can still be raised by an alt-left-click anywhere on the window, a normal click on the window decorations, or by special messages from pagers, such as activation requests from tasklist applets. This option is currently disabled in click-to-focus mode. Note that the list of ways to raise windows when raise_on_click is false does not include programmatic requests from applications to raise windows; such requests will be ignored regardless of the reason for the request. If you are an application developer and have a user complaining that your application does not work with this setting disabled, tell them it is _their_ fault for breaking their window manager and that they need to change this option back to true or live with the "bug" they requested.

key.name: action-double-click-titlebar
key.description: This option determines the effects of double-clicking on the title bar. Current valid options are 'toggle_shade', which will shade/unshade the window, 'toggle_maximize' which will maximize/unmaximize the window, 'toggle_maximize_horizontally' and 'toggle_maximize_vertically' which will maximize/unmaximize the window in that direction only, 'minimize' which will minimize the window, 'shade' which will roll the window up, 'menu' which will display the window menu, 'lower' which will put the window behind all the others, and 'none' which will not do anything.

key.name: action-middle-click-titlebar
key.description: This option determines the effects of middle-clicking on the title bar. Current valid options are 'toggle_shade', which will shade/unshade the window, 'toggle_maximize' which will maximize/unmaximize the window, 'toggle_maximize_horizontally' and 'toggle_maximize_vertically' which will maximize/unmaximize the window in that direction only, 'minimize' which will minimize the window, 'shade' which will roll the window up, 'menu' which will display the window menu, 'lower' which will put the window behind all the others, and 'none' which will not do anything.

key.name: action-right-click-titlebar
key.description: This option determines the effects of right-clicking on the title bar. Current valid options are 'toggle_shade', which will shade/unshade the window, 'toggle_maximize' which will maximize/unmaximize the window, 'toggle_maximize_horizontally' and 'toggle_maximize_vertically' which will maximize/unmaximize the window in that direction only, 'minimize' which will minimize the window, 'shade' which will roll the window up, 'menu' which will display the window menu, 'lower' which will put the window behind all the others, and 'none' which will not do anything.

key.name: auto-raise
key.description: If set to true, and the focus mode is either "sloppy" or "mouse" then the focused window will be automatically raised after a delay specified by the auto_raise_delay key. This is not related to clicking on a window to raise it, nor to entering a window during drag-and-drop.

key.name: auto-raise-delay
key.summary: Delay in milliseconds for the auto raise option
key.description: The time delay before raising a window if auto_raise is set to true. The delay is given in thousandths of a second.

key.name: theme
key.description: The theme determines the appearance of window borders, titlebar, and so forth.

key.name: titlebar-uses-system-font
key.summary: Use standard system font in window titles
key.description: If true, ignore the titlebar_font option, and use the standard application font for window titles.

key.name: titlebar-font
key.description: A font description string describing a font for window titlebars. The size from the description will only be used if the titlebar_font_size option is set to 0. Also, this option is disabled if the titlebar_uses_desktop_font option is set to true.

key.name: num-workspaces
key.description: Number of workspaces. Must be more than zero, and has a fixed maximum to prevent making the desktop unusable by accidentally asking for too many workspaces.

key.name: wrap-style
key.description: The wrap style is used to determine how to switch from one workspace to another at the border of the workspace switcher. When set to "no wrap", nothing will happen if you try to switch to a workspace past the border of the workspace switcher. If set to "classic", the old marco behavior is used: the end of one row leads to the beginning of the next and the end of a column leads to the beginning of the next. If set to "toroidal", workspaces are connected like a doughnut: the end of each row leads to its own beginning and the end of each column leads to its own beginning.

key.name: visual-bell
key.description: Turns on a visual indication when an application or the system issues a 'bell' or 'beep'; useful for the hard-of-hearing and for use in noisy environments.

key.name: audible-bell
key.description: Determines whether applications or the system can generate audible 'beeps'; may be used in conjunction with 'visual bell' to allow silent 'beeps'.

key.name: visual-bell-type
key.description: Tells Marco how to implement the visual indication that the system bell or another application 'bell' indicator has been rung. Currently there are two valid values, "fullscreen", which causes a fullscreen white-black flash, and "frame_flash" which causes the titlebar of the application which sent the bell signal to flash. If the application which sent the bell is unknown (as is usually the case for the default "system beep"), the currently focused window's titlebar is flashed.

key.name: compositing-manager
key.description: Determines whether Marco is a compositing manager.

key.name: compositing-fast-alt-tab
key.summary: Fast Alt-Tab with compositing manager (disable thumbnails)
key.description: If set to true, no window thumbnails will be displayed in the alt-tab popup window when the compositing manager is enabled. Application icons will be displayed instead. Note that on high resolution screens with many visible windows there can be a perceptible lag in rendering.

key.name: reduced-resources
key.summary: If true, trade off usability for less resource usage
key.description: If true, marco will give the user less feedback by using wireframes, avoiding animations, or other means. This is a significant reduction in usability for many users, but may allow legacy applications to continue working, and may also be a useful tradeoff for terminal servers. However, the wireframe feature is disabled when accessibility is on.

key.name: application-based
key.summary: (Not implemented) Navigation works in terms of applications not windows
key.description: If true, then Marco works in terms of applications rather than windows. The concept is a bit abstract, but in general an application-based setup is more like the Mac and less like Windows. When you focus a window in application-based mode, all the windows in the application will be raised. Also, in application-based mode, focus clicks are not passed through to windows in other applications. Application-based mode is, however, largely unimplemented at the moment.

key.name: disable-workarounds
key.summary: Disable misfeatures that are required by old or broken applications
key.description: Some applications disregard specifications in ways that result in window manager misfeatures. This option puts Marco in a rigorously correct mode, which gives a more consistent user interface, provided one does not need to run any misbehaving applications.

key.name: center-new-windows
key.summary: Determines if new windows are created on the center of the screen
key.description: If set to true, new windows are opened in the center of the screen. Otherwise, they are opened at the top left of the screen.

key.name: allow-tiling
key.description: If enabled, dropping windows on screen edges maximizes them vertically and resizes them horizontally to cover half of the available area. Drag-dropping to the top maximizes the window if allow-top-tiling is enabled.

key.name: allow-top-tiling
key.summary: Whether to maximize the window when dragged to the top of the screen
key.description: If enabled, drag-dropping a window to the top of the screen will maximize it. Only works when allow-tiling is enabled.

key.name: allow-tile-cycling
key.summary: Whether to enable cycling through different tile sizes
key.description: If enabled, tiling a window will cycle through multiple different sizes by using the same keyboard shortcut multiple times in a row.

key.name: placement-mode
key.description: The window placement mode indicates how new windows are positioned. "automatic" means the system chooses a location automatically based on the space available on the desktop, or by a simple cascade if there is no space; "pointer" means that new windows are placed according to the mouse pointer position; "manual" means that the user must manually place the new window with the mouse or keyboard.

key.name: show-desktop-skip-list
key.summary: List of applications ignored by show-desktop
key.description: Comma separated class list. Each running GUI application referenced to given windows manager class will be ignored by 'Show Desktop' functionality.

key.name: icon-size
key.summary: Icon size in alt-tab popup window
key.description: Size of the application icons displayed in alt-tab popup window. The screen's scale factor is applied to this value.

key.name: alt-tab-max-columns
key.summary: Maximum number of columns in alt-tab popup window
key.description: The popup window will be expanded to fit up to these many entries per row.

key.name: alt-tab-expand-to-fit-title
key.summary: Expand the alt-tab popup window to fit longer window titles
key.description: The popup window may be expanded up to the width determined by the config parameter 'alt-tab-max-columns'.

key.name: name-1
key.description: The name of a workspace.

key.name: run-command-1
key.description: The keybinding that runs the correspondingly-numbered command in /apps/marco/keybinding_commands The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action.

key.name: run-command-2
key.description: The keybinding that runs the correspondingly-numbered command in /apps/marco/keybinding_commands The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action.

key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action.

key.name: switch-to-workspace-12
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action.

key.name: switch-to-workspace-left
key.summary: Switch to workspace on the left of the current workspace
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action.

key.name: switch-to-workspace-right
key.summary: Switch to workspace on the right of the current workspace
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action.

key.name: switch-to-workspace-up
key.summary: Switch to workspace above the current workspace
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action.

key.name: switch-to-workspace-down
key.summary: Switch to workspace below the current workspace
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action.

key.name: switch-to-workspace-prev
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action.

key.name: switch-group
key.summary: Move between windows of an application, using a popup window
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action. This keybinding may be reversed by holding down the "shift" key; therefore, "shift" cannot be one of the keys it uses.

key.name: switch-group-backward
key.summary: Move backward between windows of an application, using a popup window
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action. This keybinding may be reversed by holding down the "shift" key; therefore, "shift" cannot be one of the keys it uses.

key.name: switch-windows
key.summary: Move between windows, using a popup window
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action. This keybinding may be reversed by holding down the "shift" key; therefore, "shift" cannot be one of the keys it uses.

key.name: switch-windows-backward
key.summary: Move backward between windows, using a popup window
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action. This keybinding may be reversed by holding down the "shift" key; therefore, "shift" cannot be one of the keys it uses.

key.name: switch-windows-all
key.summary: Move between windows on all workspaces, using a popup window
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action. This keybinding may be reversed by holding down the "shift" key; therefore, "shift" cannot be one of the keys it uses.

key.name: switch-windows-all-backward
key.summary: Move backward between windows on all workspaces, using a popup window
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action. This keybinding may be reversed by holding down the "shift" key; therefore, "shift" cannot be one of the keys it uses.

key.name: switch-panels

If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action. This keybinding may be reversed by holding down the "shift" key; therefore, "shift" cannot be one of the keys it uses.

key.name: switch-panels-backward

If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action. This keybinding may be reversed by holding down the "shift" key; therefore, "shift" cannot be one of the keys it uses.

key.name: cycle-group
key.summary: Move between windows of an application immediately
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action. This keybinding may be reversed by holding down the "shift" key; therefore, "shift" cannot be one of the keys it uses.

key.name: cycle-group-backward
key.summary: Move backward between windows of an application immediately
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action. This keybinding may be reversed by holding down the "shift" key; therefore, "shift" cannot be one of the keys it uses.

key.name: cycle-windows
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action. This keybinding may be reversed by holding down the "shift" key; therefore, "shift" cannot be one of the keys it uses.

key.name: cycle-windows-backward
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action. This keybinding may be reversed by holding down the "shift" key; therefore, "shift" cannot be one of the keys it uses.

key.name: cycle-panels
key.summary: Move between panels and the desktop immediately
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action. This keybinding may be reversed by holding down the "shift" key; therefore, "shift" cannot be one of the keys it uses.

key.name: cycle-panels-backward
key.summary: Move backward between panels and the desktop immediately
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action. This keybinding may be reversed by holding down the "shift" key; therefore, "shift" cannot be one of the keys it uses.

key.name: command-1
key.summary: Commands to run in response to keybindings
key.description: The /apps/marco/global_keybindings/run_command_N keys define keybindings that correspond to these commands. Pressing the keybinding for run_command_N will execute command_N.
